1516741810_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
> [mnemonic](#comment_11_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): How about donations? Donations incentivises creator <-> consumer relationship without third parties.

That link isn't working for me. What site is it referring to?

> [pipczyk](#comment_1_1699hLXPT6n4Gr2CXnGNuMQvviZ2SZq51P): Sorry to say but ad mechanism/network. Without money zeronet will stay a curiosity

I'm blocking ads, because even the most popular websites on the clearnet have ads with malware payloads.

I've even complained in a review of Bacon Camera that its ads have the same problem. The developer thinks I'm lying, says they use Google's Adsense, so that's worrying.

ZeroNet is better without ads, IMHO.

I would block clearnet resources too if Blokada allowed me to block internet access to a browser, but Blokada gets rid of what is an actual danger to my devices.

> [mnemonic](#comment_12_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Donation model based on micro-transactions for content you're consuming. Should be accessible now.

I still get the connection refused error.

> [mnemonic](#comment_13_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): I am seeding it, port is open.. I'll just have to paste it here I guess.

You've made progress, but content.json download fails.

> [helium](#comment_1_1Pv5CdXMDJm5k5iAp4SVbutnMg2ue8e58p): I do not want to upvote anything, because I think that I should try to build things myself in stead of yelling that somebody else please do X, because I like X, but I find that ZeroNet is an excellent medium for archives of relatively small artifacts like photos, small videos, texts. sound files.

It's okay to propose a concept if you have your ideas laid out, and maybe simple ideas will catch someone's interest too. Krixano liked the layout I proposed, though he was asking for social network suggestions to begin with ever since he thought about making one.

People like the voice messaging idea.

Nofish showed interest in prioritizing bandwidth to the currently viewed site, but doesn't know how to do that yet.

People also like the ZeroMobile idea, but there's no native support built into ZeroNet to handle it.

So, you can put your ideas out there and vote for what you like while you know that it's not all so simple. I don't think people mind.

We're all looking forward to an expanded app ecosystem.

I get it that you don't want to pester people. That's how I am. I was probably quite annoying, so now I dish ideas out more thoughtfully and less rapidly. I do need to keep notes before I forget though. I had a few ponderings and ideas that have escaped me.

All I can offer is ideas since I don't know how to build a dynamic site, as is the case with many of us.

You might have great ideas worth discussing and exploring, and that's perfectly fine.

> [helium](#comment_2_1Pv5CdXMDJm5k5iAp4SVbutnMg2ue8e58p): In that case: (server side)API FOR OTHER PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES.  [...]

I find it unnecessary as well. Maybe if the code is portable to Java or C++ without much need for compatibility checks might it be good for someone, but web browsers do enough already.

Really, all that gets in the way of a native-like experience on ZeroNet is the browser UI.

1517087760_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body: Some comments don't show when submitted. Bottom comments have grayed out text when editing after clicking the pencil icon and I'm unable to click within the text. (on Android)

Sometimes in editing mode, having the phone in portrait doesn't allow you to access all or sometimes any of the buttons Cancel, Delete and Submit. This is also a ZeroTalk bug that I never complained about since I can simply rotate to landscape.

With Firefox, the edit button is unclickable in portrait mode. Also a ZeroTalk bug. On ZeroTalk, the edit button used to jump up and down beside the comment when I can click on it, but it wouldn't do anything. I don't think it happens anymore, but keep that in mind with your fork.
Another common bug between the sites is I can't upvote/un-upvote anything in Firefox Android.
